Servus,

	This is why when people learn JUnit, they should learn how to
put=
 a
	test suite together "by hand" first, and realize that the test
runner
	=
is actually just automating some of what would otherwise be
their work.
	It=
's a little thing, but important. 

I'm not sure, if this is everytime the =
best way.
 
If use a tool, most of the time I'm not intersted in the detail=
s of that
tool. I use it as a blackbox and I'm happy if it works how I expe=
ct it.
After some time of experience and if I have to use this tool very
in=
tensive, it could be, that I'm going to dive deeper into the inwards.
 
Act=
ually I'm at that point right now. I'm writing a
TestPlanGenerator-tool, th=
at creates TestCases and TestSuites from the
XMI-Export of an UML-modeling-=
tool, and now I have to have a closer look
at the JUnit-framework ......
 
=
Wolfgang
